answer: Man is this mental being, this mental consciousness working as mental force, aware in a way of the universal force and life of which he is part but, because he has not knowledge of its universality or even of the totality of his own being, unable to deal either with life in general or with his own life in a really effective and victorious movement of mastery. ...To find the conditions under which this inner impulsion is satisfied is the problem man must strive always to resolve...

questions: What is the soul?
Do we have two souls?
answer: There is a double soul or psychic term in us... we have a double psychic entity in us, the surface desire-soul which works in our vital cravings, our emotions, aesthetic faculty and mental seeking for power, knowledge and happiness, and a subliminal psychic entity, a pure power of light, love, joy and refined essence of being which is our true soul behind the outer form of psychic existence...

questions: What is Matter, really?
Is Matter just an illusion?
answer: Matter is Sachchidananda represented to His own mental experience as a formal basis of objective knowledge, action and delight of existence.

questions: Why is Matter such an obstacle to spiritual life?
What is the 'knot of matter'?
answer: The fundamental opposition Matter presents to Spirit is this that it is the culmination of the principle of Ignorance... the culmination of bondage to mechanic Law... the culmination of the principle of division and struggle... because of Matter Life is gross and limited and stricken with death and pain, because of Matter Mind is more than half blind, its wings clipped, its feet tied to a narrow perch...

questions: Can this physical body become divine?
Is an earthly immortality possible?
answer: The evolution of a nobler physical existence not limited by the ordinary conditions of animal birth and life and death, of difficult alimentation and facility of disorder and disease and subjection to poor and unsatisfied vital cravings ceases to have the appearance of a dream and chimera and becomes a possibility... And this means... a physical life fit for a divine inhabitant and... the conquest of death, an earthly immortality.

questions: What are the fundamental principles of our existence?
How do we ascend from Matter back to Spirit?
answer: Our existence is a sort of refraction of the divine existence, in inverted order of ascent and descent, thus ranged,— Existence—Matter; Consciousness-Force—Life; Bliss—Psyche; Supermind—Mind. The Divine descends from pure existence through the play of Consciousness-Force and Bliss and the creative medium of Supermind into cosmic being; we ascend from Matter through a developing life, soul and mind and the illuminating medium of supermind towards the divine being.

questions: How did we fall from knowledge into ignorance?
What is the link between our mind and the Supermind?
answer: We are aware of a sealike downpour of masses of a spontaneous knowledge... At the source of this Intuition we discover a superconscient cosmic Mind in direct contact with the Supramental Truth-Consciousness... not Mind as we know it, but an Overmind that covers as with the wide wings of some creative Oversoul this whole lower hemisphere of Knowledge-Ignorance, links it with that greater Truth-Consciousness while yet at the same time with its brilliant golden Lid it veils the face of the greater Truth from our sight... This then is the occult link we were looking for; this is the Power that at once connects and divides the supreme Knowledge and the cosmic Ignorance.
citation: [TLD, Supermind, Mind and the Overmind Maya]

questions: When will our spiritual journey end?
Why must we keep striving spiritually?
answer:
As all must be until the Highest is gained
In whom the world and self grow true and one:
Till that is reached our journeying cannot cease.

questions: Can spiritual bliss be a trap?
Is achieving a state of bliss the final goal?
answer:
A glory and sweetness of satisfied desire
Tied up the spirit to golden posts of bliss.

questions: What is the limitation of the human mind?
Is our intellect the ultimate source of Truth?
answer: An architect of knowledge, not its source.

questions: What is the spiritual purpose of being human?
What potential lies within our current nature?
answer:
Our human state cradles the future god,
Our mortal frailty an immortal force.

questions: How does the intellect try to understand Truth?
What is the method of the logical mind?
answer:
It cut Truth into manageable bits
That each might have his ration of thought-food,
Then new-built Truth’s slain body by its art

questions: What is the role of myth and imagination?
How does wisdom grow from darkness?
answer:
Darkness grew nurse to wisdom’s occult sun,
Myth suckled knowledge with her lustrous milk;

questions: What is the realm of early light?
Where was our mind born?
answer:
He came into a realm of early Light
And the regency of a half-risen sun.
Out of its rays our mind’s full orb was born.

questions: Where do the driving ideas of our ignorant life come from?
What is the origin of the forces of suffering and desire?
answer:
The ideas that drive the obscure embodied spirit
Along the roads of suffering and desire
In a world that struggles to discover Truth,
Found here their power to be and Nature-Force.

questions: What is the great challenge of our climb to knowledge?
What must we overcome to find Truth?
answer:
Out of earth’s heavy smallness we must break,
We must search our nature with spiritual fire:

questions: How did consciousness emerge in a material world?
How can Nescience know?
answer:
Its skill endorsing Matter’s right to think
Cut sentient passages for the mind of flesh
And found a means for Nescience to know.

questions: Where does true knowledge come from?
Is knowledge acquired externally or awakened from within?
What is the purpose of Nature's work in us?
How is our inner spiritual potential realized?
answer:
The mighty daemon lies unshaped within,
To evoke, to give it form is Nature’s task.

questions: Why does spiritual progress on Earth seem so slow?
What is the pace of planetary evolution?
answer: Only a slow advance the earth can bear.

questions: What is the fundamental error of the unenlightened mind?
How does ignorance limit our perception of reality?
answer: She takes for measuring-rod her ignorance.

questions: What is the aspiration of the developing mind?
What is the fundamental journey of consciousness?
answer:
A passage she cut through from Night to Light,
And searched for an ungrasped Omniscience.

questions: How does the mind learn in a world of ignorance?
What is the learning process for the dawning consciousness?
answer:
Her thought starts from an original nescient Void
And what she teaches she herself must learn.

questions: Why is ultimate truth often hidden within religions and creeds?
How are deeper realities veiled for our protection?
answer:
And hid the deity in creed and guess
That the World-Ignorance might grow slowly wise.

questions: Why is our perception of reality so fragmented?
How does the earthly mind grasp for knowledge?
answer:
Incapable of the soul’s direct inlook
She sees by spasms and solders knowledge-scrap,

questions: What power guides the developing mind?
What is the hidden inspiration behind our thoughts and actions?
answer:
In her eyes however darkly fringed was lit
The Archangel’s gaze who knows inspired his acts
And shapes a world in its far-seeing flame.

questions: What is the half-risen sun?
How does Sri Aurobindo describe the dawning power of the Mind?
answer:
This was the imbroglio made by sovereign Mind
Looking from a gleam-ridge into the Night

questions: What is the primary error of the physical mind?
How does the physical mind mistake habit for reality?
answer:
It sees as Law the habits of the world,
It sees as Truth the habits of the mind.

questions: How does the physical mind define truth and wisdom?
What are the limitations of a purely materialistic worldview?
answer:
External fact it figures as sole truth,
Wisdom identifies with the earthward look,

questions: What does the physical mind prioritize?
Why does the lower mind choose safety over spiritual expansion?
answer:
Preferring a safe foothold upon things
To the dangerous joy of wideness and of height.

questions: What is the physical mind's relationship to the unknown?
Why does the lower mind resist new ideas?
answer:
Abhorring change as an audacious sin,
Distrustful of each new discovery

questions: What is the function of the physical mind in relation to the spirit?
How does the lower mind guard against higher spiritual influences?
answer:
A watch-dog of the spirit’s sense-railed house
Against intruders from the Invisible,

questions: What is the underlying cosmic principle that the physical mind reflects?
Why do even revolutions struggle against inertia?
answer:
Even in change is treasured changelessness;
Into inertia revolution sinks,

questions: What is the paradoxical drive of the vital mind?
Can desire, even when based on nothing, lead to a higher purpose?
answer:
It based on vacancy stupendous claims,
In Nothingness born to Nothingness returned,
Yet all the time unwittingly it drove
Towards the hidden Something that is All.

questions: What defines the character of the vital mind?
What is the inherent nature of the life-force?
answer:
A brilliant instability was its mark,
To err its inborn trend, its native cue.

questions: What is the danger of the vital mind?
How can brilliant spiritual energy be misused?
answer:
It climbed to drag down Truth into the mire
And used for muddy ends its brilliant Force.

questions: What motivates the vital mind?
For the life-force, what is the 'charm of life'?
answer: Attempt, not victory, was the charm of life.

questions: What is the unique strength of the vital mind?
How can passion perceive what reason misses?
answer:
Its passion caught what calm intelligence missed.
Insight of impulse laid its leaping grasp
On heavens high Thought had hidden in dazzling mist,

questions: What is the domain of the vital mind?
What does the life-force seek?
answer: Ignorance was its field, the unknown its prize.

questions: What is the core function of Reason?
How does the intellect try to handle a mysterious universe?
answer: She strove to reduce to rules the mystic world.

questions: What is the central paradox of Reason's mission?
On what basis does Reason try to solve the world's problems?
answer:
Ignorant of all but her own seeking mind
To save the world from Ignorance she came.

questions: What does Reason create in its attempt to understand reality?
How does the intellect try to contain life?
answer:
She leans to forge her credos and iron codes
And metal structures to imprison life
And mechanic models of all things that are.

questions: How does Reason substitute its own concepts for reality?
What is the relationship between the seen world and the world of thought?
answer: For the world seen she weaves a world conceived:

questions: What is the great limitation of pure intelligence?
Can Reason alone lead to spiritual breakthroughs?
answer:
In her high works of pure intelligence,
In her withdrawal from the senses’ trap,
There comes no breaking of the walls of mind,
There leaps no rending flash of absolute power,
There dawns no light of heavenly certitude.

questions: Is intellectual knowledge ever certain?
What fundamental flaw is inherent in all of Reason's knowledge?
answer:
A million faces wears her knowledge here
And every face is turbaned with a doubt.

questions: What is the nature of intellectual progress?
Does the constant change of ideas lead to a final answer?
answer:
This constant change spells progress to her eyes:
Her thought is an endless march without a goal.

questions: Why can't Reason grasp the totality of existence?
Is there a perspective from which the intellect can see the whole truth?
answer:
There is no summit on which she can stand
And see in a single glance the Infinite’s whole.

questions: What is the paradox of Reason's impartiality?
If the mind is open to everything, can it arrive at certainty?
answer: Open to every thought, she cannot know.

questions: How permanent are the conclusions of the intellect?
What is the relationship between Reason's truths and Time?
answer:
Absolute her judgments seem but none is sure;
Time cancels all her verdicts in appeal.

questions: Is intellectual knowledge true illumination?
How does intellectual understanding relate to fundamental Ignorance?
answer:
Its rays are a lantern’s lustres in the Night;
She throws a glittering robe on Ignorance.

questions: What mistake does Reason make when dealing with facts?
How does intellectualism miss the essence of truth?
answer:
As if she knew not facts are husks of truth,
The husks she keeps, the kernel throws aside.

questions: What is the ultimate result of a purely materialistic worldview?
What is the conclusion of the 'grand new Thought' that denies spirit?
answer:
Then ends this mighty and unmeaning toil,
The Void is left bare, vacant as before.

questions: What happens when Reason's seemingly perfect systems are complete?
What reveals the limitations of our knowledge?
answer:
A lightning from the undiscovered Truth
Startled her eyes with its perplexing glare
And dug a gulf between the Real and Known
Till all her knowledge seemed an ignorance.

questions: Where is the final key to transformation found?
What is the ultimate solution when all external methods fail?
answer:
Or we may find when all the rest has failed
Hid in ourselves the key of perfect change.

questions: What is the ultimate limitation of the intellect?
Can ultimate reality be grasped by thinking?
answer:
For not by Reason was creation made
And not by Reason can the Truth be seen
citation: [SAV, 68.5: bright kingdoms of the rising sun]

questions: What is the condition for knowing the Truth?
Why is all partial knowledge ultimately a form of ignorance?
answer:
For nothing is known while aught remains concealed;
The Truth is known only when all is seen.
citation: [SAV, 68.5: bright kingdoms of the rising sun]

questions: What is the spiritual purpose of our ignorance?
What potential is hidden within our state of not-knowing?
answer: Our ignorance is Wisdom’s chrysalis,
citation: [SAV, 68.5: bright kingdoms of the rising sun]

questions: Can Reason reveal God?
What happens when the intellect tries to grasp the infinite?
answer:
Reason cannot tear off that glimmering mask,
Her efforts only make it glimmer more;
citation: [SAV, 68.5: bright kingdoms of the rising sun]

questions: Will the ultimate Truth ever be revealed?
What is the destiny of the hidden divine face?
answer: One day the Face must burn out through the mask.
citation: [SAV, 68.5: bright kingdoms of the rising sun]

questions: What will end our Ignorance?
What is the future evolution of consciousness on Earth?
answer:
A fire shall come out of the infinitudes,
A greater Gnosis shall regard the world...Its aim to life, to Ignorance its close.
citation: [SAV, 68.5: bright kingdoms of the rising sun]

questions: What is the nature of the world constructed by Reason?
Is our intellectual understanding of the world final?
answer:
The world she has made is an interim report
Of a traveller towards the half-found truth in things
citation: [SAV, 68.5: bright kingdoms of the rising sun]

questions: What lies beyond the ordinary thinking mind?
What are the higher powers of consciousness that witness our world?
answer:
And from their high station looked down on this world
Two sun-gaze Daemons witnessing all that is.

questions: What is the nature of the higher Life-Thought?
What inspires acts of superhuman will?
answer:
Iconoclast and shatterer of Time’s forts,
Overleaping limit and exceeding norm,
It lit the thoughts that glow through the centuries
And moved to acts of superhuman force.

questions: What is the limitation of the higher Life-Thought?
Why do grand visions often fail to be realized?
answer:
Apt to conceive, unable to attain,
It drew its concept-maps and vision-plans
Too large for the architecture of mortal Space.

questions: What is the nature of the pure Thought-Mind?
What kind of consciousness perceives from a state of detached witnessing?
answer:
An imagist of bodiless Ideas,
Impassive to the cry of life and sense,
A pure Thought-Mind surveyed the cosmic act.

questions: What is the limitation of the higher Life-Thought?
Why do grand visions often fail to be realized?
answer:
Apt to conceive, unable to attain,
It drew its concept-maps and vision-plans
Too large for the architecture of mortal Space.

questions: What is the nature of the pure Thought-Mind?
What kind of consciousness perceives from a state of detached witnessing?
answer:
An imagist of bodiless Ideas,
Impassive to the cry of life and sense,
A pure Thought-Mind surveyed the cosmic act.

questions: What is the paradox of these higher planes of thought?
Can a being aspire to the eternal while being bound by time?
answer:
Captives of Space, walled by the limiting heavens,
In the unceasing circuit of the hours,
Yearning for the straight paths of eternity,

questions: What can the higher Life-Thought perceive?
Is it possible to glimpse immortality?
answer:
It saw afar the unreached Immortal’s home
And heard afar the voices of the gods.

questions: What can the higher Life-Thought perceive?
Is it possible to glimpse immortality?
answer:
It saw afar the unreached Immortal’s home
And heard afar the voices of the gods.

questions: How does the spirit know itself?
Can knowledge of the spirit be attained through thought?
answer:
For the spirit is eternal and unmade
And not by thinking was its greatness born,
And not by thinking can its knowledge come.

questions: What is our potential as spiritual beings in a physical world?
How can we be grounded yet aspire to the boundless?
answer:
Its feet are steadied upon finite things,
Its wings can dare to cross the Infinite.

questions: What is the source of our current existence?
What is our future potential?
answer:
Origin of the little that we are,
Instinct with the endless more that we must be,

questions: Are we completely cut off from higher worlds?
How do we experience divinity on Earth?
What sustains us through life's struggles?
What is the source of our hope for a better future?
answer:
A faith in things that are not and must be
Lives comrade of this world’s delight and pain,

questions: What is our true origin?
Why do we feel like exiles on Earth?
answer:
Ourselves are citizens of a mother State,
Adventurers, we have colonised Matter’s night.
But now our rights are barred, our passports void;
We live self-exiled from our heavenlier home.

questions: What is the origin of human thought?
Why is our thought process so limited?
answer:
An errant ray from the immortal Mind
Accepted the earth’s blindness and became
Our human thought, servant of Ignorance.

questions: Are our dreams and ideals merely fantasies?
Where does the reality of our aspirations exist?
answer:
All things are real that here are only dreams,
In our unknown depths sleeps their reserve of truth,

questions: Is it possible to return to our spiritual home?
Can we access higher states of consciousness?
answer:
Our souls can climb into the shining planes,
The breadths from which they came can be our home.

questions: How does reality function in higher worlds?
What is the relationship between knowledge and action in ideal planes?
answer:
The unfallen planes, the thought-created worlds
Where Knowledge is the leader of the act
And Matter is of thinking substance made,
